trans-unit.source: Simulate a mouse click on an <input type=image>. Match by sub-string match of alt text, name or src

seg-source.mrk: Simulate a mouse click on an <input type=image>.
Match by sub-string match of alt text, name or src

target.mrk: Simulate a mouse click on an <input type=image>.
Match by sub-string match of alt text, name or src

trans-unit.source: Object variable of any DOM element (will be converted to the associated document object)

seg-source.mrk: Object variable of any DOM element (will be converted to the associated document object)

target.mrk: Object variable of any DOM element (will be converted to the associated document object)

trans-unit.source: Value used to match element - treatment based on $sMode

seg-source.mrk: Value used to match element - treatment based on $sMode

target.mrk: Value used to match element - treatment based on $sMode

trans-unit.source: "src" = (Default) match the url of the image

seg-source.mrk: "src" = (Default) match the url of the image

target.mrk: "src" = (Default) match the url of the image

trans-unit.source: "id" = match the id of the image (see remarks)

seg-source.mrk: "id" = match the id of the image (see remarks)

target.mrk: "id" = match the id of the image (see remarks)

trans-unit.source: "alt" = match the alternate text of the image

seg-source.mrk: "alt" = match the alternate text of the image

target.mrk: "alt" = match the alternate text of the image

trans-unit.source: [optional] If the img text occurs more than once, specifies which instance you want by 0-based index

seg-source.mrk: If the img text occurs more than once, specifies which instance you want by 0-based index

target.mrk: If the img text occurs more than once, specifies which instance you want by 0-based index

trans-unit.source: [optional] specifies whether to wait for page to load before returning

seg-source.mrk: specifies whether to wait for page to load before returning

target.mrk: specifies whether to wait for page to load before returning

trans-unit.source: 0 = Return immediately, not waiting for page to load

seg-source.mrk: 0 = Return immediately, not waiting for page to load

target.mrk: 0 = Return immediately, not waiting for page to load

trans-unit.source: 1 = (Default) Wait for page load to complete before returning

seg-source.mrk: 1 = (Default) Wait for page load to complete before returning

target.mrk: 1 = (Default) Wait for page load to complete before returning

trans-unit.source: 0 or -1 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 or -1 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 or -1 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: The <input type=image> form element is handled differently from all others.

seg-source.mrk: The <input type=image> form element is handled differently from all others.

target.mrk: The <input type=image> form element is handled differently from all others.

trans-unit.source: It is not recognized by Internet Explorer as a member of the form element collection and this function therefore gives you other means of getting a reference to it within the document using src, name or alt strings.

seg-source.mrk: It is not recognized by Internet Explorer as a member of the form element collection and this function therefore gives you other means of getting a reference to it within the document using src, name or alt strings.

target.mrk: It is not recognized by Internet Explorer as a member of the form element collection and this function therefore gives you other means of getting a reference to it within the document using src, name or alt strings.

trans-unit.source: Regardless of the object passed to this function, it looks for the form element within the full document context.

seg-source.mrk: Regardless of the object passed to this function, it looks for the form element within the full document context.

target.mrk: Regardless of the object passed to this function, it looks for the form element within the full document context.

trans-unit.source: "name" is no more supported when using HTLM5 but still accepted and equivalent to "id" for HTML5 pages.

seg-source.mrk: "name" is no more supported when using HTLM5 but still accepted and equivalent to "id" for HTML5 pages.

target.mrk: "name" is no more supported when using HTLM5 but still accepted and equivalent to "id" for HTML5 pages.
